# unicorn/require-number-to-fixed-digits-argument <Badge type="info" text="Pedantic" />

<div class="rule-meta">
<Alert class="fix" type="info">
<span class="emoji">üõ†Ô∏è</span> An auto-fix is available for this rule.
</Alert>
</div>

### What it does

Enforce using the digits argument with Number.toFixed()

### Why is this bad?

It's better to make it clear what the value of the digits argument is when calling Number.toFixed(),
instead of relying on the default value of 0.

### Examples

Examples of **incorrect** code for this rule:

```javascript
number.toFixed();
```

Examples of **correct** code for this rule:

```javascript
number.toFixed(0);
number.toFixed(2);
```

## How to use

To **enable** this rule in the CLI or using the config file, you can use:

::: code-group

```bash [CLI]
oxlint --deny unicorn/require-number-to-fixed-digits-argument
```

```json [Config (.oxlintrc.json)]
{
  "rules": {
    "unicorn/require-number-to-fixed-digits-argument": "error"
  }
}
```

:::
